newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - Boeing, McDonnell up. [CORRECTED 15:55 GMT]
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - Boeing, McDonnell up. [CORRECTED 15:55 GMT]

text.p: Aircraft makers Boeing Co and McDonnell Douglas Corp rose before markets opened Wednesday following the European Commission's recommended approval of their $15 billion merger, traders said. (Corrects from "European Commission's approval" to "European Commission's recommended approval".)
Boeing was trading at 58-1/2, up from a Tuesday closing price of 56-3/16. McDonnell Douglas was trading at 73-1/4, up from a close of 72.
The European Union's executive panel recommended approval of the merger after Boeing agreed to concessions, easing fears of a trade war.
Traders said technology stocks also were active as some major players reported quarterly earnings.
Bay Networks Inc was trading at 31-1/8, up from a close of 28-5/16. The maker of computer networking gear reported better-than-expected fourth-quarter earnings Tuesday.
Netscape Communications Corp was trading at 44-7/8, down slightly from a 44-8/16 close. The company reported a sharp jump in second-quarter operating income.
Software giant Microsoft Corp was trading at 144-1/2 from a close of 144-2/16, and Intel Corp was at 89-1/2 from a close of 88-12/16.
Qualcomm Inc fell to 48-3/4 from a close of 51-10/16.
Apache Corp was trading at 35-1/2 from a close of 33-10/16. Anadarko Petroleum Corp rose to 68-1/4 from 65-9/16.
The increases came after Standard and Poors added the energy companies to its index of 500 stocks.
Mexico's Telefonos de Mexico fell to 49-3/4 from 50-2/16 after the company reported its quarterly net profits fell compared with the year-before period.
